labels.label:
1. Nifi ingest HWX Registry serialized Avro events. The HWX registry will put the schema identifier in beginning bytes of each payload
2. Nifi extracts the schema key and fetches schema from the HWX Schema Registry and then converts from AVro to CSV.
3. These CSV records are then enriched and converted into Avro Records and pushed into a Kafka Topic.
When publishing to Kafka Topic, Nifi will look up the schema associated with the kafka topic and then use it to serialize into Avro before publishing into Kafka

1. Nifi ingest CSV events with schema identifier embedded 2. Nifi converts them to CSV records using schema fetched from HWX Schema Registry. 3. These CSV records are then enriched and converted into Avro Records and pushed into a Kafka Topic.
The schema associated with the Avro objects is retrieved from the HWX Schema Registry based on the schema registered for the Kafka topic.
In this approach, each event is converted into a single CSV Process Record and then Nifi uses SQL to filter different events to different Kafka topics. Each of these CSV events are converted into Avro before being pushed into Kafka topic

1. Nifi ingest CSV events with schema identifier embedded 2. Nifi converts them to CSV records using schema fetched from HWX Schema Registry. 3. These CSV records are then enriched and converted into Avro Records and pushed into a Kafka Topic.
The schema associated with the Avro objects is retrieved from the HWX Schema Registry based on the schema registered for the Kafka topic.
In this approach events associated with the the same schema are grouped together as Process Records into a single File and each of those process records are pushed into Kafka Topic in Avro format
Setup the schema keys for the Kafka Topicthat we are publishing to.
Serialize CSV into Avro by fetching Schema associated with kafka topic from the HWX Schema REgistry.

processors.name: Remove Line Headers and Trailing Pipe

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.name: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

entry.key: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.name: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

processors.name: Publish Events to Truck Stream Topics

entry.value:
import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets
def flowFile = session.get() if(!flowFile) return
lat = flowFile.getAttribute('latitudeForGeoCodeEnrichment') lng = flowFile.getAttribute('longitudeForGeoCodeEnrichment')
flowFile = session.write(flowFile, {inputStream, outputStream -> inputStream.eachLine { line -> fmt_addr = "2106 Morton Ave, Des Moines, IA 50317, USA\n" outputStream.write("$line$fmt_addr".toString().getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8)) } } as StreamCallback)
session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS)

labels.label: Serialize CSV into Avro by fetching Schema associated with kafka topic from the HWX Schema REgistry.

Upstream app is sending avro objects serialized via HWX Schema REgistry into kafka topics
Use ConsumeKafkaRecord to read Avro and convert to CSV by doing the following: 1. Get schemaId from beginning bytes of serialized AVro object 2. Use the schemaId to lookup the schema 3. Convert Avro object to CSV Records using the schema

entry.value:
import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets
def flowFile = session.get() if(!flowFile) return
lat = flowFile.getAttribute('latitudeForGeoCodeEnrichment') lng = flowFile.getAttribute('longitudeForGeoCodeEnrichment')
flowFile = session.write(flowFile, {inputStream, outputStream -> inputStream.eachLine { line -> fmt_addr = "2106 Morton Ave, Des Moines, IA 50317, USA\n" outputStream.write("$line$fmt_addr".toString().getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8)) } } as StreamCallback)
session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS)

def flowFile = session.get() if(!flowFile) return
lat = flowFile.getAttribute('latitudeForGeoCodeEnrichment') lng = flowFile.getAttribute('longitudeForGeoCodeEnrichment')
